item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Dance like you're stamping on a human face forever, love like you've been in a serious car crash that minced the front of your brain, stab like no one can arrest you, and live like there's no such thing as God." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Drinking is fun! It makes me feel horrible and sexy!" -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "You're miserable, edgy and tired. You're in the perfect mood for journalism." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "I want a tattoo over my heart that reads TRY HARDER YOU LAZY PARAMEDIC SHITBAG OR I WILL HAUNT YOUR BEDROOM FOREVER" -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Be authentic to your dreams. Be authentic to your own idea about yourself. Grind away at your own minds and bodies until you become your own invention. Be Mad Scientists." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by warren ellis
item.description: "good morning sinners. vampiric red bull intake in pub smoking compound commenced. day of heavy brain-fingering ahead." -- warren ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Santa Monica's only walkable if death is no hurdle. The air's the wrong colour. People put sunglasses on their dogs. It's a hideous place where humans are not welcome and those who stay suffer eight kinds of brain damage." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "To be happy, we must not be too concerned with others." -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You can't create experience, you undergo it." -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "We all carry within us places of exile, our crimes, our ravages. Our task is not to unleash them on the world; it is to transform them in ourselves and others." -- Albert Camus

item.title: tony add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: tony add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Madness, and then illumination." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: tony add a quote by Max Brooks
item.description: "Use your head; cut off theirs." -- Max Brooks

item.title: tony add a quote by Max Brooks
item.description: "Remember; no matter how desperate the situation seems, time spent thinking clearly is never time wasted." -- Max Brooks

item.title: tony add a quote by Max Brooks
item.description: "When I believe in my ability to do something, there is no such word as no." -- Max Brooks

item.title: tony add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: tony add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: tony add a quote by Jim Jarmusch
item.description:
"Nothing is original. Steal from anywhere that resonates with inspiration or fuels your imagination. Devour old films, new films, music, books, paintings, photographs, poems, dreams, random conversations, architecture, bridges, street signs, trees, clouds, bodies of water, light and shadows. Select only things to steal from that speak directly to your soul. If you do this, your work (and theft) will be authentic. Authenticity is invaluable; originality is non-existent. And don’t bother concealing your thievery - celebrate it if you feel like it. In any case, always remember what Jean-Luc Godard said: “It’s not where you take things from - it’s where you take them to."
[<i>MovieMaker Magazine</i> #53 - Winter, January 22, 2004 ]" -- Jim Jarmusch
